page.title: 10 SCHOOL & RUSHMORE HILL
page.content: {Pratts Bottom County Primary School} is a typical rural village school,built in 1895 it stands in Hookwood Road, formerly known as Old Rushmore Hill. Some 60 pupils attend it for primary education and apart from an annexe added to the original building it has changed little in outward appearance over the years. During the 1980's the school was part of a successful {Co-operation Project} involving the other local village schools of Downe, Cudham and Chelsfield in developing new curriculum ideas. {Rushmore Hill} was the main London to Dover road, until Polhill was cut, and coach drivers used to put up at the local inns overnight. Reports of Highwaymen abounded, the most famous robbery taking place in 1798. Even Dick Turpin is said to have travelled this road.
